sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Raoul Sahn. It's great to have you with us. Let's take a look at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian missiles strike Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odessa, killing a teenage boy amid fears Russia is opening a new battlefront in the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The EU moves towards phasing out Russian oil imports by the end of the year, but there are still many

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: divisions on a possible gas import ban from the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And are abortion rights under threat in the US? Protests erupt outside the Supreme Court over fears justices are poised to overturn a ruling legalising abortion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities say a Russian missile attack struck the Black Sea port of Odessa on Monday evening, killing a 15-year-old in a residential building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Earlier Moscow said it had also hit a railway bridge across the Dniester estuary west of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Its destruction cuts access to shipments of weapons and other cargo from neighboring Romania. Experts say the strike shows that Russia is opening a new battlefront in the conflict. East Ukraine continues to be Russia's main target. Video of a historic school burning after being shelled in Luhansk was released by local authorities. The U.S. has repeated its claim that Russia is planning to annex Donetsk and Luhansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: According to the most recent reports, we believe that Russia will try to annex the Donetsk People's Republic and Luhansk People's Republic, in quotes, so-called, to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The reports state that Russia has plans to engineer referenda on joining Russia sometime in mid-May. In the Ukrainian capital, locals have begun rebuilding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Areas from north of the Kiev region were shelled and occupied by Russian troops just a month ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Once Russian forces withdrew, municipal emergency teams and volunteers started working to restore basic services such as electricity, water and gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After Denmark became the first Nordic country to reopen its embassy in Kiev, Sweden is to follow suit on Wednesday, after closing its embassy temporarily following Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: invasion. A slow trickle of people fleeing the devastated city of Mariupol are arriving in Zaporizhia, but not in the numbers Ukraine was hoping for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A first group of civilians trapped for weeks inside Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks are expected, but efforts to save more people from the horrific conditions inside the huge plant have stalled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Those who've made it reveal what life has been like under the Russian bombardment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They bombed Azovstal for a month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: All the markets are destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: All the shops are destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: All drugst are destroyed. All the shops are destroyed. All drugstores destroyed. No medicine, no food, nothing. And the children? I hope you never have to suffer like this. Never again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Hundreds remain trapped in underground bunkers and tunnels beneath the steelworks, the last stronghold of resistance to Russia's siege. There's no mention of wounded Ukrainian forces being included in any further evacuations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And across the rest of the city, there are still an estimated 130,000 people struggling to survive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But according to footage released by Russia-backed separatists, some Mariupol residents have returned to their destroyed homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You know, home is home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It may be damaged, but I have my own spoon, fork and plate here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Who needs me?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: If I go, I should take something with me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I won't go far with the pension I have.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We don't plan to leave." But for others, there is no choice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's very bad at our home. We don't have a house anymore. We don't have a city anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We left on Saturday and reached Vasilivka. But we couldn't leave as there was active fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Russian siege of Mariupol has left those trapped in dire conditions in a wider war which has uprooted 13 million people and killed thousands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said that visas for Ukrainians fleeing war could have

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: been processed faster. So far, some 86,000 visas to the UK have been issued out of over 117,000 requests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And only 27,000 refugees have actually arrived in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: British Home Secretary Priti Patel is also facing legal action over this visa backlog.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some of the delays have been made worse by applicants not being informed of their visa approvals. Some charities have been calling on the Homes for Ukraine programme to be immediately overhauled to stop the potential endangerment of vulnerable peoples.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Brussels says it's preparing for some difficult months ahead in its energy sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: EU ministers in this field met on Monday for an extraordinary meeting to discuss the bloc's strategy after Russia decided to cut off gas to Poland and Bulgaria last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now the EU is working to ensure the continent's gas storage will be full by autumn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's currently at 32 per cent, and according to the commission in charge of energy, Kadri Simpson, any member state could be the next victim of Moscow's energy cuts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Brussels is also working in parallel on a sixth package of sanctions against Russia that will focus on a phased-out embargo of oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Germany, one of the main opponents, is now agreeing to it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Germany, one of the main opponents, is now agreeing to it. JENS LIEBERMAN, German President- After two months of work, I can say Germany is not against an oil ban on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Of course, it is a heavy load to bear, but we are ready to do that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have to prepare the harbors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have to prepare the pipelines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So time is helpful, but I think other countries have bigger problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, The proposal could be announced by the European Commission as soon as Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But for some experts, the plan must be handled with care, as it has the potential to backfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If we are now moving to sanction Russian oil with a gradual embargo, Russia might respond immediately by saying, OK, then we cut the gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And leaving Russia this strategic game at the end might not be the best option for the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It might be better for the EU to put a tariff immediately on both oil and gas coming from Russia into the European Union. Some countries are instead calling for a punitive import tax on Russian energy rather than an embargo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Christopher Pitchers, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Our viewers at this stage must feel like they've been hearing about the potentiality of a Russian oil embargo for weeks because of course it's been under discussion, intense discussion night and day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And in fact, all last weekend, we saw European Commission officials pick up the phone lines and call the various EU capitals to gauge the temperature on how far they were willing to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Because member states like Hungary, for example, like Slovakia, also Italy, Austria, very much dependent on Russian oil and of course, Russian natural gas and very reluctant to go for an embargo like this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So what we've heard is the European Commission, as early as tomorrow, will be coming out with a compromise proposal that could then be signed off on Wednesday by EU ambassadors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This compromise proposal would see a phase-out of Russian oil by the end of the year perhaps and it would see special measures and exemptions for those countries who rely most on Russian oil and we've seen and heard from the German minister today for energy Robert Huyback very much in favour saying we are on board with this and we're looking at ways to make sure that it doesn't hurt Germany too much and of course Poland as well its neighbours saying that they'll step in and help we heard the climate minister from poland saying that they will help germany wean off this dependency on russian oil abortion rights activists are protesting outside the u.s supreme court over fears that justices

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: could overturn a 1973 ruling legalizing abortion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to a draft of a majority opinion leaked to newspaper Politico, the landmark Roe v. Wade decision was wrong from the start.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's the beginning to the end. The court documents say it's about we have to keep fighting because we know the Supreme Court is swayed by public opinion and so we have to come out mass mobilization of people to say that the reversal of Roberson Way is good and it will save lives and that is good.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The leak of a draft opinion while a case is still pending is a breach of Supreme Court secrecy and a family planning organization has reminded everyone that for now abortion is still legal and still a right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, if the ruling is overturned, the regulation of abortion or even its ban would be left up to individual states, removing 50 years of constitutional protections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Several Republican-led states have already passed highly restrictive abortion laws in anticipation of such a ruling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian laws in anticipation of such a ruling.
